column5: ~~~Another fantastic report for the past weekend, I like the other who were there, all had a good time.

Great report & pics wayne !!!! im glad i finally got to meet you,thats sure one nice boat ,with all the goodies,you have there !!!...looks like the crew you had in your boat had a blast too bad the fish wernt willing to play,but you guys did get a few and man thats one huge sheephead   that terry got for sure....cheers
ah..yeah  hummmm it's hard to tell just what kind of fish that really was..ahh
LOL, Sheepeye?  Great report guys, Glad too see you all out there again
If he did I really don't want to know!  Great report Wayne, thanks.
Forgot about the DRIFT Terry LOL!!! I'm glad I put my coffee down just before reading this post! -Brian
Hey Terry - that fish must be one of those picerheads that i have heard so much about.   Don
Great report and I enjoyed meeting you Wayne
So did you eat it?
well I wasn't sure what it was, so I cut it up and made it part of the pot luck dinner...LOL
Nice report and pics. I'm not sure I would let any drums on board my new lund. Thanks for sharing.
well, we fish to the beat of a different DRUM      freshwater drum that is.....LOL
yah see that slim patch on the back carpet...it's still fri ggin there! No more of them Drum'eye's in my boat Terry! You're only allowed to boat Picker'eyes from now on bud!
I like to hold them up and holler over to some guy 2 or 3 hundred feet away "check out the size of this smallmouth"
Great report!!! Really nice ....whatever the heck that thing is!!! I really have to hit Quinte one of these days.

I left for the Picton at 7:30 am on Thursday and tried to time it so Terry and I hit there at the same time. Dano was stuck on a job site and would join us later that night. It’s tricky with one pulling a boat, the other not, but Terry got there..walked up the hill to the office and I pulled in just as he did so at 11:45. We were on the water and trolling the reach by 1PM.  Doesn’t he look really sad out fishing on a Thursday afternoon?!  Lol    There was no shortage of those damn suspended fish out there…but they weren’t hungry!    We got skunked on Thursday and came back for supper, went out to yak with some lads up in the motel unit and  then found a nice blaze that Glen had started. We actually thought our cottage was on fire at first…but no.. just Glen with a ‘bama wood pile fire.     Headhunter left home about 3:30am so he could join us in the boat for 7am….and he was more than on time. Found him wandering around outside about 6:30…peeking in the windows itchin to get on the water!  Off we went..and we trolled and we trolled. Joe/Dano and Terry drivin.    Another shot…Joe, Dano and Terry pointing where he wants to troll next! LOL    Long after lunch Dano finally gets one on in front of the Cement factory across from Merland.      Right after that he also caught a nice size pike…but my camera was on the fritz…we got a shot on Dan’s camera so he’ll add that I’m sure.  Saturday we were again up bright and squirrly… a nice Shimano sunrise!    And a scenery shot    Not much goin on…so time for the three amigo pose!    Saturday we got the big skunkaru and came back to have supper, bon-fire and watch a hockey game + some of the pot luck festivities. Here’s Joey selling beer for $5 each !    Dan showing the only safe way to get to your boat in the morning at Merland. A little no slip tape would go a long way to save them from lawsuit one day on those damn plastic “Jetdock” systems.     Sunday we hit the water once again and Terry wanted to leave at noon…so about 11am of course he had to catch a nice 30” x 14lb SHEEPSHEAD. Gave him a good fight…pulled lead core off like crazy…stunk like hell and my boat is still a slim mess from that baby. Such a big fish..with no gill flaps to get a hold of. Funny though that fishing was so slow that I was being asked for bait colour and distance back by someone on the VHF…just so he could get a customer a fish! LOL     More action shots…or non-action shots. Trolling…trolling and more trolling…nadda!     The Glenora Ferry missed us again! Almost got our planner boards one day.    Sunday evening…sunset 4:40…fish on 4:42 (thanks Dan for letting me take your rod…dang that didn’t sound right) 25” and a bit. Not sure if this was a migratory or resident fish.    Dano with another at 4:45   Time to get Dano back to his girlfriend!    Dano and I stayed over to fish Monday. Very little boat traffic…those stacked fish out on the reach had disappeared/dispersed and he managed to pick up one little eater size fish, that we of course released to grow for another day.    We loaded up the boat and had it ready to trailer by about 3:30. Home in the pouring rain by 8PM Monday night.  And other than that….what happened at Quinte…stays at Quinte!
oops.... posted under Paul again, dang!  I'll fix it.  Joey

Your a dead man Wayne     It was actually 25 bucks a beer, notice he tried to get away without giving me the fiver  Very nice report and really great pics. So no skunkaroo for you  Nice Sheepshead Terry, did you mount that  Joey
Nice fish and nice boat!
Great report and pics Wayne.  From this and the other reports it looks like everyone had a great time.
excelant report wayne, looks like you had some numbers anyway to keep ya busy
looks like you all had a great time despite the lack of hungry fish.  Maureen
Nice report!!!,,,and a nice little fishin machine ya have there!!!,,,,glad ya had a good time!!!
glad you guys hooked into some fish there, wayne! nice meeting ya.. and dam nice boat...  kevin
dang  I guess I was the jinx  great report  I had a great time with you guys and all the other fine people I met the time sure went fast.........  I wasn't the only guy pointing the way
Thanks again for having me in your boat Wayne. Despite the lack of fish for you guys, I had a good time.
Hey walleye dan nice to see you caught fish
hmm.. im going to join the club and change my nick name too...
nice looking eyes!
Good report Wayne oh and by the way nice Yacht.We almost had you beat coming in .But we had to back off.
Great Report.   The Bay has been cruel to me many a time.   But you guys still boated fish on a tough week-end.   Good on you..  Thats a wicked boat man.  Cheers
exellent report Wayne....... That was my first look at your 'Ship' BTW..... AWESOME.Bud...real sa-weet
Great Report Wayne i guess next time i should have just taken you up on your offer instead of waiting around all day LOL Mabey next time!
Well, another fine Quinte report Wayne. Glad everyone had fun. I couldn't make it, but might head down for a day this coming weekend. I haven't been on OFC much lately. Missing it large.  cheers

Great stuff Wayne! Just curious but did anyone in the OFC contingent troll Picton harbour at night? When I was there a couple weeks ago the shad were just starting to enter as were the big 'eyes. Some pretty easy fishin' at night if you can pull yourself away from the campfire....  Cheers

Great report and thanks again for taking me in Wayne. I had a great time staying with you, Dan and Terry and would do it again in a heartbeat. Sorry for Friday morning at 5AM... I was having Lakair flashbacks! -Brian
Thanks for the great read Wayne, you have a definite flair for writing fish'n stories  Good to see you boyz put a few decent fish in the boat too !!
Great report Wayne...it was great seeing you again at the G2G.  Brian's boat was almost swamped by your wake on Sunday afternoon....even though you were a good half mile away....LOL.

hey Brian it was great having you in the cabin(don't think I can call it a cottage with the bats and mice and everything else) if you get my DRIFT....LOL  and remember what happens at BOQ, stays at BOQ
